articles.headline: Putin’s Forces Battle in East Ukraine to Feed His Hunger for a Victory
articles.snippet: The fighting has intensified ahead of Russia’s May 9 Victory Day holiday commemorating the Soviet Union’s triumph over Nazi Germany.
articles.abstract: The fighting has intensified ahead of Russia’s May 9 Victory Day holiday commemorating the Soviet Union’s triumph over Nazi Germany.
articles.lead_paragraph: DONETSK REGION, Ukraine — Fighting raged on Thursday across eastern Ukraine, from the Kharkiv area in the north where Ukrainian forces regained ground, to Mariupol in the south, where Russians breached the last Ukrainian redoubt in a steel plant, as Moscow’s forces battled to present President Vladimir V. Putin with something he can call victory.

articles.headline: U.S. Intelligence Helped Ukraine Strike Russian Flagship, Officials Say
articles.snippet: The help that sank the Moskva, the most significant loss by any navy in 40 years, is part of an administration effort providing real-time battlefield intelligence to Ukraine.
articles.abstract: The help that sank the Moskva, the most significant loss by any navy in 40 years, is part of an administration effort providing real-time battlefield intelligence to Ukraine.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States provided intelligence that helped Ukrainian forces locate and strike the flagship of Russia’s Black Sea fleet last month, another sign that the administration is easing its self-imposed limitations on how far it will go in helping Ukraine fight Russia, U.S. officials said.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper, Eric Schmitt and Julian E. Barnes

articles.headline: Has Shanghai Been Xinjianged?
articles.snippet: Shanghai used to be the glamorous China, while Xinjiang was the dark China. Now both are casualties of authoritarian excess.
articles.abstract: Shanghai used to be the glamorous China, while Xinjiang was the dark China. Now both are casualties of authoritarian excess.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shanghai and Xinjiang used to be the two sides of the China coin.

articles.headline: Job Growth Shows Continuing Vigor of U.S. Economy
articles.snippet: The Labor Department reported a gain of 428,000 jobs in April, along with a 5.5 percent increase in average hourly earnings from a year earlier.
articles.abstract: The Labor Department reported a gain of 428,000 jobs in April, along with a 5.5 percent increase in average hourly earnings from a year earlier.
articles.lead_paragraph: The U.S. economic rebound from the pandemic’s devastation held strong in April with another month of solid job growth.

articles.headline: One Village at a Time: The Grinding Artillery War in Ukraine
articles.snippet: The advances by the Ukrainian army in the north have been modest, but they are emblematic of both sides’ strategy: maneuvering artillery to gain territory.
articles.abstract: The advances by the Ukrainian army in the north have been modest, but they are emblematic of both sides’ strategy: maneuvering artillery to gain territory.
articles.lead_paragraph: RUSKA LOZOVA, Ukraine — The Ukrainian major had a few tasks to complete as he made the rounds along his army battalion’s front line. One platoon commander needed anti-tank weapons. Another wanted to show off a new line of trenches that his forces had dug following a recent Ukrainian advance.
articles.byline: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Natalia Yermak and Tyler Hicks

articles.headline: Market Pain Isn’t Over, but You Will Get Through This
articles.snippet: Head-spinning volatility in financial markets isn’t all that puzzling when you consider the problems the Federal Reserve is grappling with, our columnist says.
articles.abstract: Head-spinning volatility in financial markets isn’t all that puzzling when you consider the problems the Federal Reserve is grappling with, our columnist says.
